$  bc,
&$  min,
&$  max 
)

Computes a DHCP IP range.

This function provides a guess only.

Parameters:
[in] $ip string System internal ip.
[in] $net string System local network.
[in] $bc string System broadcast address to guess max range.
[out] $min string DHCP IP range min.
[out] $max string DHCP IP range max.

ComputeIfDefs ( $  ip,
$  mask,
&$  net,
&$  bc,
&$  cidr 
)

Computes network, broadcast, and CIDR net addresses, given ip and netmask.

Quoting from nice explanations here: http://downloads.openwrt.org/people/mbm/network

if we take the ip and netmask and do an AND: (hint, AND the columns)

11000000 10101000 00000001 00001011 = 192.168.1.11 (some ip address) 11111111 11111111 11111111 11110000 = 255.255.255.240 (netmask) AND: 11000000 10101000 00000001 00000000 = 192.168.1.0 (network address)

This gives our network address, the lowest address in the subnet Now, flip the netmask: (hint, NOT the columns)

11111111 11111111 11111111 11110000 = 255.255.255.240 (netmask) NOT: 00000000 00000000 00000000 00001111 = 0.0.0.15 (NOT 255.255.255.240)

then OR this with the network address: (hint, OR the columns)

11000000 10101000 00000001 00000000 = 192.168.1.0 (network address) 00000000 00000000 00000000 00001111 = 0.0.0.15 (NOT 255.255.255.240) OR: 11000000 10101000 00000001 00001111 = 192.168.1.15 (broadcast address)

Parameters:
[in] $ip string IPv4 address.
[in] $mask string Netmask.
[out] $net string Network address.
[out] $bc string Broadcast address.
[out] $cidr string CIDR.

Definition at line 243 of file lib.php.

References $Re_Ip.

Referenced by ApplyConfig().

00244 {
00245     global $Re_Ip;
00246     
00247     if (preg_match("/^$Re_Ip$/", $ip) && preg_match("/^$Re_Ip$/", $mask)) {
00248         $net= long2ip(ip2long($ip) & ip2long($mask));
00249         $bc= long2ip(ip2long($net) | ~ip2long($mask));
00250         $cidr= $net.'/'.(32 - round(log(sprintf("%u", ip2long('255.255.255.255')) - sprintf("%u", ip2long($mask)), 2)));
00251     }
00252 }

SetWuiPasswd (  ) 

Sets both admin and user passwords on the WUI.

Password should have at least 8 alphanumeric chars.

Definition at line 446 of file lib.php.

References $View, AskPass(), and cwwui_syslog().

00447 {
00448     global $View;
00449     
00450     // In case
00451     $View->Model= 'system';
00452     
00453     echo "\nPassword for web administration interface:\n";
00454     
00455     while (TRUE) {
00456         echo "Password? (will not echo) ";
00457         $passwd= AskPass();
00458         
00459         echo "\nPassword? (again) ";
00460         if ($passwd === AskPass()) {
00461             if (preg_match('/^\w{8,}$/', $passwd)) {
00462                 echo "\n";
00463                 // Update admin password
00464                 if ($View->Controller($output, 'SetPassword', 'admin', sha1($passwd))) {
00465                     cwwui_syslog(LOG_NOTICE, __FILE__, __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, 'User password changed: admin');
00466                     // Update user password
00467                     if ($View->Controller($output, 'SetPassword', 'user', sha1($passwd))) {
00468                         cwwui_syslog(LOG_NOTICE, __FILE__, __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, 'User password changed: user');
00469                     }
00470                     else {
00471                         cwwui_syslog(LOG_ERR, __FILE__, __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, 'Password change failed: user');
00472                     }
00473                 }
00474                 else {
00475                     cwwui_syslog(LOG_ERR, __FILE__, __FUNCTION__, __LINE__, 'Password change failed: admin');
00476                 }
00477                 echo "Successfully set admin and user passwords.\n\n";
00478                 break;
00479             }
00480             else {
00481                 echo "\nERROR: Choose a password with at least 8 alphanumeric characters.\n";
00482             }
00483         }
00484         else {
00485             echo "\nERROR: Passwords do not match.\n";
00486         }
00487     }
00488 }
